revised_title: The Role of Joseph Banks in English Science and Culture
tldr: This book review discusses Joseph Banks' significant influence on English science and culture. Banks, although not a scientist himself, supported and encouraged the work of many notable figures in the scientific community. His patronage greatly benefited the Royal Society, which he helped develop into an influential institution. The review also mentions other related works, such as Richard Yeo's "Defining Science: William Whewell, Natural Knowledge, and Public Debate in Early Victorian Britain."
